intro: Cymopterus glomeratus var. parvus, commonly known as the small clustered eveningflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels of small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. This variety is distinguished by its smaller flower clusters compared to the typical form of Cymopterus glomeratus.
